WorkItem.Description:
My suggestion is to change the EvaluateOptions parameter of the Expression method to List<EvaluateOptions>.  This will allow the user to use multiple options on the same object.

Ie: EvaluateOptions.NoCache and EvaluateOptions.IgnoreCase

As it is, you can only have one or the other.
WorkItem.Summary: Allow for multiple EvaluateOptions when calling Expression

Comments.Message: EvaluateOptions is defined with [Flags] attribute. So to do what you want you just do EvaluateOptions.NoCache | EvaluateOptions.IgnoreCase
